reference.title: New Android Widget Project
reference.shortdesc: Creates a project for an Android widget.

strow.stentry: A name for the newly created Eclipse project. Note that MOTODEV Studio will create a folder for your project using this name; therefore, the name you supply must follow the rules for filenames on your host operating system.

Indicates whether projects should be created in the current workspace. To specify a different location, clear this option and then use the Location field to specify the folder in which the project is to be created.
Specifies the folder in which projects are created. By default projects are created in the current workspace. Clear the Use default location option to specify a different location.
Specifies the Android platform against which the application is to be built.
The name of your widget application as it will appear to the user on the Android device.
The full Java package name for your application. Note that this needs to be a unique identifier; use standard domain-style naming.
The name for the application's main activity. This is the name for the class stub that will be generated by the plugin.

A value that corresponds to the minimum required API level. This value determines whether or not your application will run on a given Android device: if the Min SDK version is greater than the level supported by the device, the application will not run on that device. This field is automatically set when you specify a Target, but can be overridden.
